file_content.text: Get out of my sight, slave.
I'm telling you, overseer, it cannot be done. I went into the tomb, I saw the Dashade across the chasm, but I could not get to it.
Look, if I can't do it, there's no way on Korriban the slave will ever get that map.
Damn it, Ffon. Couldn't you have faked something--
--I can't fake a giant Force assassin!
But the map! The map! Lord Zash is adamant--she will not take an apprentice without the map!
Lord Zash can't be such a fool as you think, Harkun. How long would I last if I gave her a fake map? How long until she discovered it?
I'm telling you, Lord Zash wants the impossible. No one is ever going to get that map!
You don't mean this map, do you?
Ahem.
Sorry I'm late, but I have the map!
I've got it!
No one except me, you mean.
Guess again.
The map! And--the Dashade! G--get that monster out of here this instant! And give me the map.
No, it's not possible! You wretch, you filth--you must have cheated somehow. How did you do it? How did you release the monster?
I am not a monster. I am Khem Val, servant of Tulak Hord, devourer of the rebels at Yn and Chabosh, consumer of the Dromund system. And I am hungry.
R--right. You--you must have cheated--you must have. You'll pay for this.
Tell me!
I had some help from Lord Zash.
There was assistance.
Don't lie, filth. You're not fit to polish Lord Zash's boots.
You don't want to know.
You cheated, that's why. You cheated!
He's not a monster--he's my friend.
Don't call him names!
Then I guess it's too bad your friend's not here to protect you, filth. Because you're dead.
Ffon! Patience. You will have your chance at this whelp--after you personally deliver this map to Lord Zash.
I worked hard for that map, and I'll kill both of you if I have to.
I won't let you do that.
The map is mine, Harkun.
Hey!
Eat them both, Khem.
Dashade, kill!
With pleasure.
Keep your pet at bay for just a moment, acolyte. I would have a word with Ffon.
That's a mistake.
Protest all you want, slave. You'll die the same. Hurry, Ffon.
Don't go anywhere, Ffon.
Lord Zash?
Yes, Ffon. Now where's my map?
H--here, Lord Zash. R--right here.
You found it for me, Ffon? How wonderful.
Actually, I was the one who found it.
It was me.
He couldn't have found it if he tried.
Do you believe that?
I will kill you, Ffon.
Silence! Ffon will tell me what happened, won't you, Ffon? You wouldn't dare lie to me, would you?
Because it would be a shame for me to discover that you lied to me. Now one more time--did you bring this map back from Naga Sadow's tomb?
I--I--n--no. No, I didn't. I didn't. I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
Harkun, you fool. In any other group for any other lord, this young man would have torn the other acolytes to shreds. What were you trying to prove?
That you could outsmart me? That you knew better than me what kind of person I wanted for an apprentice?
You fool!
Yeeaaaarrrrrgh!
There's your pet, Harkun. Clean this mess up. Apprentice--meet me in my chambers upstairs.
Yes, master.
Wow, she really fried him. Poor guy. I almost feel sorry for him now.
Too bad for Ffon.
She showed you, Harkun. Maybe next time you'll learn to obey your superiors, huh?
That's what you get.
This is not the end. Without Lord Zash to save you, you're nothing.
I have connections that will hunt you wherever you go.
Just face it--your star is dead. You're nothing.
Deal with it.
I'm sorry it turned out this way, Harkun. I know you never liked me much, but I learned a lot from you.
You were a good teacher.
What? Well, I guess it is an overseer's job to--to--inspire his charges.
Now get going, slave. I mean, apprentice.
Talk all you want.
Get out of my sight, slave. Your new master is waiting for you upstairs.
Your trial is in the tomb of Naga Sadow. Get the map or don't come back.
Your final trial will be to retrieve an ancient map from the innermost chamber of Naga Sadow's tomb--which has never been breached in thousands of years.
But before you get the map, you'll have to awaken an ancient assassin called a Dashade that sleeps in the tomb. You cannot access the map without him, understand?
What exactly is a Dashade?
Dashade?
They're a lost race of assassins that the ancient Sith used to devour their Force-using enemies. This one'll probably eat you the moment he's freed.
Sounds simple.
What's so special about this map?
And I care because?
Lord Zash wants it.
Oh--and one more thing. You'll be competing with Ffon for this map. Whoever brings it back will be Lord Zash's apprentice. The other will die.
And Ffon's already started--so my advice? Run, slave. Run.
You filthy, rotten...! I'm going to kill Ffon, but that's not half as bad as what I'm going to do to you.
Miserable scum!
As you say, overseer. I will not linger any longer.
I'm on my way.
Don't worry.
Ahem. One moment, please.
Lord Zash--what are you doing here?
Overseer. Are you implying that I--a Lord of the Sith--don't have the right to go where I please within the Academy of the Sith?
No, of course not, Lord Zash.
Good. I saw the last acolyte arrive. I wanted to see the hopefuls off on their final trial. Where's--um--what's his--the red one, Ffon?
He finished his trial early, so I sent him on rather than keeping him waiting for this--
Pity. I just finished translating the wonderful text this acolyte brought from Tulak Hord's tomb, and it's most illuminating. I don't know that the map can be retrieved without it.
Well, well, well. It's a good thing I didn't start running, isn't it, Harkun?
You're an idiot, overseer.
What do you mean?
Uh-oh, Ffon's in trouble.
Your pet won't like this.
It's too late. Ffon's already left. You can't just--
--Give one acolyte an unfair advantage over the other? Overseer, when has being Sith ever been about being fair?
Ffon has his head start, and he's a clever boy. Perhaps he'll figure it out himself.
Yes--yes, perhaps.
Now, my dear acolyte, here is what you must do to free the Dashade. There are rods scattered throughout the tomb of Naga Sadow.
These rods are the keys to the chamber where the ancient assassin is imprisoned. You will need to place the rods in the chamber door and electrify them.
I don't know exactly the reason--but it is clear that you will not be able to retrieve the map without the Dashade. But be careful--he is very dangerous.
Is there anything else I should know about the Dashade?
Any other advice?
It's a Force-resistant assassin--I have reason to believe this one was placed in the tomb by Tulak Hord himself.
Don't worry.
I have yet to meet a danger I cannot defeat.
I'm not easy to kill.
I have yet to meet a danger I can't defeat.
I'm not easy to kill.
Very dangerous indeed! You can't really mean to let this filthy slave take control of a monster like the Dashade!
This acolyte is the reason I was able to learn about the map and the Dashade in the first place.
I would warn you not to question me again, overseer.
I will return when both acolytes are back from the tomb. You will not do anything further to affect the outcome of the trial. Understood?
Yes, Lord Zash.
Good--and good luck, acolyte.
I'll be back with the map and the Dashade.
This won't take long.
Thanks.
Maybe next time you'll stay in your place, Harkun.
She showed you.
Shut up, slave. If you know what's good for you--you won't come back from that tomb.
And if you do, mark my words--you'll wish the Dashade had eaten you alive.
So go ahead, bring me the map. If you dare.
Well, well. Look who shows up at long last. I half expected to hear you'd crossed some Dark Lord upstairs and finally got yourself killed.
None of the others have shown up either. I assume they're dead by now--which means you and Ffon are the last ones.
So I just kill Ffon and I'm Sith, right? This shouldn't take long.
Your boy is dead now.
Wrong.
What's next?
Speaking of Ffon--he seems conspicuously absent.
Where is your little pet?
You only wish it, slave. No--you took so long returning, I sent Ffon ahead.
I don't want to see you until you've been to the training grounds--second floor, slave!
You have a big mouth, slave, but no combat skills. I don't want to see you again until you've satisfied the Korriban instructors.
The training facility is on the second floor of the Academy and is usually reserved for the Dark Lords and their apprentices.
This is not a promotion, and you are not to speak to anyone except the training master when you are up there, understand? You are not fit for their presence.
You're wrong.
Do not press your luck, slave. I could just let Ffon tear you to pieces.
It would be my pleasure.
I understand. I will be careful not to step out of place.
As you say.
Please tell me Ffon can come? We'll have so much fun.
Will your pet be there?
Ffon has been training at combat his whole life. He was born to be Sith.
You are just as likely to chop your own arm off as not, slave.
Hopefully, she will.
Hopefully, he will.
Now get going to the second floor training grounds. You don't want to keep the instructors waiting.
I was just about to send Ffon off. What delayed you, slave?
Well, first Lord Zash stopped me to tell me how amazing I am, and then we got talking and I suppose I lost track of time.
Just my future master.
Well, first Lord Zash stopped me to tell me how amazing I am, and then we got talking and I guess I lost track of time.
Just my future master.
Just like a slave to make up stories. Lord Zash would crush you like a gizka if you ever crossed her path. You're not worthy of her presence.
Sorry. It won't happen again.
Apologies.
It's a shame the tomb didn't kill you.
I like to stop and smell the blood.
Taking in the scenery.
You'll be smelling your own blood soon.
Now, did you collect the text from Tulak Hord's tomb?
Here you go.
Of course, overseer. It is an honor to serve.
Yes, sir.
Of course--as always, I'm brilliant.
I never fail.
Give it here--no doubt it's been badly damaged. It's what we get for sending a worthless alien to do a Sith's job--isn't that right, Ffon?
Give it here--no doubt it's been badly damaged. It's what we get for sending a careless lowlife to do a Sith's job--isn't that right, Ffon?
What are we waiting for, overseer? Why don't we kill this wretch now?
Because he's scared of Lord Zash.
He's afraid.
Can't we get along?
You don't stand a chance.
Bring the text from Tulak Hord's tomb or don't come back.
Now, for your trial: The last, darkest secrets of Tulak Hord are buried in his tomb. Lord Zash wants this text.
But the final resting place of the dead lord is not easily trespassed. You will not be the first to die there.
Is there a reason you keep sending me into the tombs?
More Sith ruins?
Lord Zash's research is her own business and no one else's. You're not fit to know.
Any other stupid questions?
Wait a minute. You don't know, do you? You're as in the dark as I am. Lord Zash hasn't told you anything, has she?
You have no idea, huh.
No. I'm sorry my question offended you.
My apologies.
Don't you just hate how the sand on Korriban gets in everything?
I can think of a few.
Don't you hate how the sand on Korriban gets in everything?
I can think of a few.
You are begging for death, slave.
Now get going.
Yes, yes, yes... you send me into a tomb to do the impossible, hoping I die, and I come back and prove you wrong.
I know the drill.
Yes, I get it already. You send me into a tomb to do the impossible, hoping I die, and I come back and prove you wrong.
I know the drill.
Shut up, slave. I've had about enough of your mockery.
I will return with the text.
I'll be back.
Do not come back here until you've gotten the text from Tulak Hord's tomb. Out of my sight, slave!
You better not be wasting my time, slave. You better have the holocron.
You expected me to fail and die in a gruesome fashion, leaving your pet Ffon to claim victory. Sorry to disappoint.
I hate to break this to you.
Take it.
I smote my way through the tomb and claimed the prize!
I was victorious!
Let me guess. You expected me to fail and die in a gruesome fashion, leaving your pet Ffon to claim victory. Sorry to disappoint.
I hate to break this to you.
Hm. A fake, or stolen from the library, probably. I'll deal with you later. Now--I believe it's time for another demonstration. Gerr, step forward.
Yes, overseer.
Ffon--kill him.
With pleasure, overseer.
Aaaarrrrrgh!
You--you can't just--! That's not fair! I'll kill you!
Let's see you try!
No, Ffon. These weaklings are not worth your energy. Don't worry. Their demise is inevitable.
Let Gerr be an example to you. Ffon destroyed him easily, like he will destroy all of you. Are there any other objections?
No, overseer. No objections.
None, sir.
Then be quiet.
You are only giving us power, Harkun.
Don't push it.
And your comments are only hastening your death, slave.
You're heartless, Harkun. How can you be so cruel?
That's evil.
I am Sith--something you will never be.
Now, the rest of you know the next trial. Go. You, slave--stay here.
I just wanted to make sure you knew, slave. Harkun may not think you're worth killing, but I've got my eye on you. You're dead.
Why can't we just work together? Help me defeat Harkun.
Can't we team up?
Harkun? He's practically surrendered himself to me already. I don't need the aid of an inhuman weakling to crush him.
Harkun? He's practically surrendered himself to me already. I don't need the aid of a pitiful slave to fell him.
You're an idiot.
I look forward to cutting you down to size.
I can't wait to kill you.
You're nothing. Consider yourself warned.
Now, slave--you think yourself pretty clever getting that holocron, don't you?
I don't really think about it one way or the other. I did as I was told.
Just obeying orders.
Stop with your taunts and give me my next trial.
Just shut up.
If you wish to prolong your life, you will not make demands of me again, slave.
I'm that good.
You are lucky Lord Zash finds you useful.
Bring me the holocron or don't bother coming back, slave.
Now, slave--Zyn says you handled yourself expertly and as much as I find this difficult to believe, Lord Zash is satisfied with his evaluation.
Undoubtedly, Zyn helped you in some way--but you will not have his help on the next trial.
Both you and Ffon will have trials of intellect--trials that test your ability to apply your understanding of the Force to solve problems.
You don't expect a slave to be a match for me in intellect! I've been trained under the greatest teachers--
Calm down, Ffon. I certainly do not expect this slave to be a match for you. That's why you will have separate trials.
You don't need to dumb down the trials for me, though I'm sure Ffon would appreciate the help.
I'm as smart as he is!
It's okay. I can handle anything Ffon can handle.
Don't worry about me.
I don't need your charity.
You're only digging your own grave.
Ffon, you will go to the library on the second floor of the Academy and translate the following texts for Lord Zash.
Yes, overseer.
Slave, deep in the ancient, monster-infested tomb of Marka Ragnos, there is a holocron filled with dark secrets and encased in a great stone monument.
No one has figured out how to release the holocron from its stone prison in over a thousand years. You will bring this holocron to me, or you will die.
A simple errand. Need anything else in the tomb while I'm down there?
No problem.
You have no idea what awaits you, slave.
The more you make me hate you the stronger I become, Harkun. And one of these days, I'm going to be strong enough to crush you.
This only makes me stronger.
You will never be strong enough, slave.
Well, it beats going to the library I suppose....
Sounds like fun.
Hey, it beats going to the library. Yawn.
Sounds like fun.
Spoken like the idiot you are.
Marka Ragnos's final resting place is in the Valley of the Dark Lords.
You will bring back the holocron or hope that the spirit of Marka Ragnos himself returns to end your miserable existence. Now go!
Well, well, well. I had been looking forward to cutting another one of you down, but it looks like I'll be spared the trouble. Unsurprisingly, Niloc has gone missing.
Also unsurprisingly, Ffon has passed his first trial. It's only a matter of time before he tramples you all underfoot.
Does it have to be a competition? Why can't we work together?
Let's not fight.
Sounds good to me. What do you say, Ffon?
What kind of weak fool do you take me for?
Way to go, Ffon!
Good job!
Ah, what're you cheering him on for? He's not worth it!
I'll tear you apart where you stand, slave!
Patience, Ffon--an accident in the tombs is much more convincing. Now the lot of you know your next task--go. I want to speak to Ffon and our latecomer.
You say the word, my brother and I will help you take him out, okay?
You said it, brother. We got your back.
I can handle myself. You just watch your own backs.
Don't worry about me.
It's our own backs we're thinking of, believe us.
You just say the word, and I'll be at his throat like a starved tuk'ata.
This'll be fun.
You guys just say the word, and I'll be at his throat like a starved tuk'ata.
This'll be fun.
I look forward to seeing his head impaled on a stake.
If we pick a fight, we're only sinking to their level.
No, we're better than this.
Maybe you're right. But I'd rather be wrong than dead.
Just wait until I get my hands on him. Then we'll see who gets trampled.
He's so dead.
That's right! Wring his purple little neck!
Your business is with Zyn in the jails, slave.
Now, your second trial: Lord Zash has requested a special trial for you, which you will no doubt fail.
Go to Inquisitor Zyn in the jails. He will fill you in on the details--and most likely, hasten your demise.
I'm gone.
The jails? He's not going to arrest me, is he?
This isn't a trick, is it?
Don't count on my demise, Harkun. I don't die easily.
I wouldn't get my hopes up.
Don't count on my demise, Harkun. I don't die easy.
I wouldn't get my hopes up.
Don't boast, slave.
I don't want to see you again until you're back from the jails. That's all.
Ah, the last one. Always the latecomer. Now we can see what the hermit thinks of you slime.
Hm. Acolyte Kory. Step forward, please.
Yes, overseer.
You are a weak, pathetic rodent and even a lunatic like Spindrall can see this. And that means--
Aaaaah!
How could you just--you murdered her!
Yes, and let it be an example to you filth. Now, anyone else have any objections?
Those were some nice sparks. Can I try?
I like your style.
You won't hear any from me, sir.
None.
Good.
That was unnecessarily cruel. What did she do to deserve that?
Was that called for?
You've just marked yourself, fool--you're next. You may think yourself strong, but you're not.
Meet our newcomer--Ffon Althe. This is real Sith strength, and he will tear you apart and crush your bones, slaves.
Ffon comes from a very respected Sith family--one that has been among the ruling class for generations. Look long and hard--this is what a real Sith looks like.
If his family's so respected, what's he doing here?
My brother's right. You said it yourself--this group's slaves and lowlives only. So which is he?
Watch who you're insulting, wretch. I never slaved a day in my life.
Calm down, Ffon. They aren't worth your trouble.
Ffon's family was wiped out in the feuding on the Imperial capital world of Dromund Kaas, and he was thrown into the slave shipment. Fortunately, I found him.
Look on him! No connections left in the world, but pure Sith blood! This--this is Lord Zash's future apprentice! Not filth like you!
We'll see how tough he is out in the tombs. Alone. With just me and my blade for company.
I'm going to kill him.
Nice to meet you, Ffon. Hope Harkun treats you better than he treats us.
Hello!
Save your well-wishes for someone who cares, slave.
Congratulations on your new pet. Now give us the rest of the trial.
Let's keep things moving.
Congratulations on your new pet. Now give us the next trial.
Let's keep things moving.
Step this way, slave. I want to speak to you privately. The rest of you--get out of here. You know your trials. You, too, Ffon. Spindrall awaits.
Now, listen to me. Spindrall is a lunatic. His approval means nothing. You are filth and you will die. Is that clear?
As an unmuddied lake.
Yes.
Good.
You stay out of my way, I'll stay out of yours.
We don't need to fight.
Shut your mouth, wretch.
You're nothing.
You're nothing. And don't forget it.
Don't come back here until you've met the hermit, Spindrall.
Ah, the last one to arrive is finally here. I hope you don't think you're special.
It would be a shame if freedom went to your head, or if you somehow got the idea you didn't need to pass your trials to become Sith.
Lord Zash has tasked me with sorting through you refuse to find one worthy of being her apprentice, and I intend to do just that.
Who is this Zash?
Zash?
That's Lord Zash to you, slave. She's a Dark Lord of the Sith and more important than you'll ever be.
Give us a chance. We can prove ourselves.
We can do it.
We'll just see about that.
Don't get all sentimental on us. We've only just met.
Try not to cry.
Please, don't get all sentimental on us. We've only just met.
Try not to cry.
I won't.
Now, the rest of you gutter trash already know your trial. Get going while I bring our latecomer up to speed.
Watch your back, friend. And don't worry. It'll be alright. He can't kill us all.
Thanks. That means a lot coming from a beautiful girl.
[Flirt] Aw, that's sweet.
Heh. You're cute. Just watch you don't get yourself killed.
I will. And you take care of yourself.
Thanks.
Believe me, I'll be watching back, front, everywhere.
I'm not scared.
Suit yourself.
I'll attack from the front, you attack from behind, and we'll see how he fares.
We could take him.
I'll attack from the front, you take him from behind, and we'll see how he fares.
We could take him.
Uh... yeah. Looks like you can handle yourself.
Now, slave, for your trial: There's a hermit named Spindrall who lives in the tomb of Ajunta Pall in the Valley of the Dark Lords.
The Valley is a vast, sandy plain that opens into cavernous tombs, labyrinths of darkness built to house ancient, powerful Sith.
Many have died simply entering the tombs--others have gone raving mad. But that's where Spindrall lives. You will go to him or die trying.
Like we used to say in the slave pits--"Easier than spitting on an Imperial's footprint."
Simple.
You think.
What should I expect when I find him?
And then?
This Spindrall sounds like he should be in an institution, not a tomb. Why do you want me to visit him?
Seems like a nutcase.
It's not what I want, slave. It's what Lord Zash wants.
Spindrall's a lunatic, but Lord Zash sees him as some kind of prophet. Once you find him, he will test you.
Fine. I will seek the insane hermit in the incredibly dangerous tomb and take his little test.
If I have to.
I'll do my best to please Spindrall and accomplish this trial.
Don't worry.
Sounds like a good test.
Oh, what I wouldn't give to see you face the k'lor'slugs in the tomb. Heh. Horrible pincers, gigantic maws--you're no match, slave.
But there--you know your task. Spindrall lives in the tomb of Ajunta Pall in the Valley of the Dark Lords.
Your task isn't done until you have Spindrall's approval or you're in a k'lor'slug's belly.
I've always wondered what it would be like to get eaten. I imagine it could be a sort of transcendent experience...
How bad could it be?
Enough of this foolishness! Leave! Now!
Be back soon.
I bet k'lor'slug stomach smells better than your breath.
Beats talking to you.
Don't keep Spindrall waiting, slave.
I have no business with you.
Too bad for Ffon.
That's what you get.
